Reviews.Content: I really love the zoom on this camera.  The other features are nice and pretty easy to use.  Overall, nice camera for the money.  The only things I've had issues with are night shots - VERY difficult to get a good shot, It's also hard to catch a quick shot because of it's size and it also takes a while to focus.  Sometimes it's hard to get the image to focus at all.  Lots of blurry shots.  If you're after quick, clean photos, I'd suggest a smaller, simpler camera.  This is fun to play around with though.  I really like the panoramic options.  Pretty cool.  Make sure you take plenty of time to learn how to use it BEFORE you go on a big trip.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: sam1j
Reviews.Content: This is a superb camera at a superb price. I have only been amazed by the quality and versatility of the camera. The menu's are easy to navigate and offer a wide variety of functionality for even the most amateur of photographers. It is light, easy to handle and when set in 'auto mode' takes some great pictures. The LCD is super clear and the camera has great response times when taking pictures. All in all great value for money for somebody that is not yet in the "professional" market of taking pictures!

Reviews.Title: pro/con
Reviews.Author: mad monk "mad monk"
Reviews.Content: Pro: Good price for the camera. The picture quality is very good. Recovery is quick. Functions and options are plentiful.  Tech support was helpful.Con: The image stabilization doesn't seem very effective. Camera set up was a nightmare since I run a Mac.  Could not get the install menu right so had lost the manual and had to order one. The absolutely worst feature of the camera, IMHO, is the lack of a view finder. Trying to focus and compose a picture in sunlight is very difficult.Conc.: Overall it's a good camera and when I can actually  shade the view screen, shoots excellent pictures. The zoom is wonderful but at full Optical  needs a tripod or a very well grounded hand-held position.  I do not recommend trying to shoot  from a boat in rough seas or river rapids.

Reviews.Title: Might not serve as a 'point and shoot'
Reviews.Author: rlw
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a super-zoom mostly point and shoot camera, you might not be happy with this one. In the short amount of time I used it, I was disappointed with its automated performance, and my wife was also unhappy.You should know that it has essentially 6 major modes: P - for Program Automatic, iAuto - automatic mode, SCN - Scene Mode (manual), Magic - 4 special effects (Pop Art, Pinhole, Fisheye, Line), Panorama, and Beauty - for 'dynamic portraits' whatever that means. Scene Mode has 18 choices for you - a lot to scroll through manually one by one. Presumably iAuto chooses one of the 18 for you, but I wasn't happy with it. P, Program Automatic is the default mode - it seems to let you manually adjust most shooting parameters. Perhaps that means the camera does little analysis by default, allowing the photographer to make all the decisions, unlike a typical point and shoot. Be aware that the camera turns on in either P mode, or 'last mode used' - you can't set it to automatically always use iAuto mode.Macro mode is available on most of the major modes as a separate, additional setting. Sometimes Super-Macro is available.Finally, you activate the flash manually, by lifting the flash unit up. Unless you've lifted the flash, you can't change any of the flash settings. I'm used to a much older 35mm where the flash unit would pop up automatically when needed, and be manually closed.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful
Reviews.Author: Kushits
Reviews.Content: Get this i cant recommend a camera much more for the price. i am so happy with mine. i do a lot of macro work and the super macro is amazing on here.

Reviews.Title: Battery Life is Critical Issue
Reviews.Author: G. Muir
Reviews.Content: The camera is great in all respects except for those dinky batteries Olympus designed into it. If you use extensive zoom and image stabilizer features, the batteries get sucked down in no time at all. And when you are out in the emiddle of nowhere it gets a little expensive to carry a cadre of Olympus OEM batteries with you at $40 a pop. And we all know the predictability of aftermarket batteries for $5 each. My old Olympus C3040Zoom with its conventional 4 AA batteries outlives the SP-800UZ's daily expensive battery change by a month or more. Take a hint, Olympus!I've only had the camera for approximately four months but am beginning to notice that it apparently draws significant power from the battery when it is not being used. If you do not use it over a period of a few weeks it is best to keep it plugged in to either the charger or the computer so as to keep the battery up to full charge. These little batteries are simply too small for a camera of this magnitude.Then there is the charging issue. Why only offer a stock camera with just the feature of USB charging? Are we tied to our computers everywhere we go? It doesn't cost that much to throw in an external charger so as not to totally disable your camera while charging batteries. And as far as I can see, Olympus doesn't offer one! Yes, there are aftermarket chargers available but the life of the tiny batteries almost dictates using an external battery pack connected to the camera by the USB cable. Not a great solution but would allow you to take photos with more abandon without worrying when your camera is going to go to sleep. And it is more bulk to carry around to compensate for a simple oversight in the camera's design.Other comments: The lens is OK but sports noticeable optical aberrations at extended zoom ranges. Camera settings are somewhat complicated to access in a hurry and lack conventional exposure settings like on the older Olympus cameras. And it would sure would have been nice to have a threaded feature on the lens for using filters and filter holders.

Reviews.Title: Short Shooting Span
Reviews.Author: Ew Brown "the teksta"
Reviews.Content: Upon receipt of this new Olympus (point & shoot) SP800 UZ camera, I was thrilled at the potentialthat it posed offering 14 mega pixels and a 30x zoom.I own several Olympus digital cameras, the last of which was the SP510 UZ with a 7.1 mega pixels and a 10x optical zoom and each time I am anticipating the upgrade to my inevitable SLR purchase.  My disappointment is primarily with the short life spanof the required lithium ion battery  and the lack of a view finder in lieu of the LCD screen (which may be the reason for short battery life.I ordered with the camera several packs of the lesser expensive replacement batteries andhave given them the "Maximal" charge recommended to operate fully powered and still they run out before I've shot less than my 4GB SDHC memory card is 1/3 used.  I've also purchased an 8Gb card that hasn't seen the light of day.Having also purchased the recommended charger which thankfully works great as the batteries are forever needing to be charged, however if I were nowhere near a charging source I would be pissed with this overall setup.After much turmoil I've decided to keep the keep the unit because of it's price point and the potential to make anoccasional fantastic capture.Overall it's hard to determine if it's the camera or the batteries, oh yeah the Olympus battery offers a few additional shots and I'm not yet sure if it's worth the difference in cost.

Reviews.Title: Best camera yet
Reviews.Author: Ron Reefman
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th Olympus digital camera and it is by far the best one yet. I shoot a sportscar races and hockey games and the people (sometime even pro's) with expensive cameras and BIG lenses see my photos and wonder why they carry around that heavy equipment! The 30x zoom is at the very edge of being able to hand hold even with image stabilization. The LCD works good even in the sun. I miss not having a view finder, but you get used to it. And 14 MP puts you right in with the best quality out there.

Reviews.Title: A big step up for a small price
Reviews.Author: Wayno
Reviews.Content: the Oly SP800UZ is a great example of the current ultra zoom trend!  I am amazed at how much intense technology and capability is packed into this small, light, inexpensive camera.  I've used a DSLR (Canon EOS Digital Rebel) and loved the image quality but learned that I'm not willing to carry the big rig along with lenses, etc.  The point-and-shoot cameras I've used have been handy (and the old Oly 3.1 mp i've got still takes great pics), but can't even come close to the lens on this new Olympus.After using this camera for four days I must say that the zoom is EPIC.  Try the "birdwatching" setting and stand way back...you might put someone's eye out!  Colors (especially outdoors) are very true. The resolution has been great at any length, at least in good lighting conditions - i did manage to get some noise in low light, though, in the automatic mode.  Still need to play with the WB options...Great lcd for shooting/viewing, even in bright light. The menu for settings is not the fastest access, but it is an impressive array of choices/options.  I really dislike the ib software for importing images.  It suffers from what i would call "overachiever's syndrome" - do i really need to tag every photo by event, gps location/map, persons in photo etc?  No thank you!  What matters is the camera, which i'm pretty sure i will be keeping; it is almost as easy to carry as a basic compact digital but with a lens which really is the big step up.

Reviews.Title: La mejor
Reviews.Author: Patricia Colina
Reviews.Content: Esta es una cámara que ofrece las mejores opciones para alguien que se quiera iniciar en el mundo de la fotografía

Reviews.Title: Olympus SP 800 UZ
Reviews.Author: James Lon Van Vorous
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a vacation trip.  Very satisfied with the camera.  It may not do some of the things that the more expensive cameras can do, but the picture results are all that matter and this camera delivers.

Reviews.Title: After a few months, the jury is out on this so-so camera!
Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: I was truly excited about the 30X optical zoom, which is very cool however, indoor picture quality and low light pics are far from good!  I have tried and tried to tweak the parameters and cannot get a satisfactory result.  About half the time though I luck out and get some pretty amazing photos, but just not enough to make me totally happy with this purchase.  Seems to be built pretty rugged though and feels like a quality camera.  Part of the problem is that I know I'm a novice and lack in photography knowledge!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Richard Lenis Quintero
Reviews.Content: Is a Great Camera for people who don’t want to worry about adjustment. Batteries don’t last too much so buy a spare one.Gran Camara para las personas que no quieren preocuparse mucho por los ajustes. Las baterias no duran mucho asi que compra unas de repuesto.

Reviews.Title: Replacement
Reviews.Author: Jelybelly "granny"
Reviews.Content: I had this exact camera and it broke, so I replaced it with the same.  While I like the camera very much....it takes wonderful pictures....I am not happy with the pause betweenpictures and the battery doesn't last very long.  I now have 4 batteries that keep me going.  I will be getting my broken camera fixed for backup.

Reviews.Title: 3-Star
Reviews.Author: Vaibhav Tiwari
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a gift. I had plans to buy a different camera but my friend being excited by 30x zoom capability gifted this to me and ruined my plans. I accepted it whole heartedly and tried to like it whole heartedly but I haven't succeeded yet. This is what I think about the camera.Most of the weight of the camera is from the lens, still its not heavy. The build quality is very good and the controls are easy. It does gives lot of freedom to experiment. LCD screen is quite impressive so is 30x zoom. The photographs and video taken in sufficient light are quite good. Battery live is good. I especially liked panoramic mode. It has capability to take photo in bursts, with different exposure and focus.Coming to the cons, this camera does not impress when it comes to photo quality in low light. By low light I do not mean really low light. I have 6 13w cfl lighting up my 25X40ft room and still the camera will not take good photographs. The photographs look alright on the LCD but are soft as you zoom in. The photo quality will go down if you increase the ISO or zoom. Any ISO above 200 is guaranteed to give a soft or grainy photo. One way to take alright photo in low light it to use very low ISO and use a tripod but this is not feasible all the time and still the photographs will not be crisp. As a matter of fact higher ISO are useless even when its bright sunny day. Story is same for video too. There is another problem with video, you cant zoom in or out once the recording starts.So its up to you if you want zoom and alright with bad performance in low-light photo and high ISO you can give this camera a try. The resale value, I must tell, is much less.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Syka "Syka"
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera sitting in my cart for months, and finally I purchased it and I am absolutely in love with it!  The camera is small in size considering the capabilities and the lens, everything works automatically, the menu is easy to use with few buttons, and there are so many options to use that I actually have to look at the manual to see what is available.  The pictures are turning out amazing with great detail and most of the poor pictures are due to my learning curve with the settings etc.  Definitely a step up from the point and shoot digital cameras I am used to. I purchased the camera through Amazon which gave me a great savings, $100 off retail prices I was finding on other websites and in stores.

Reviews.Title: Price cut makes the deal
Reviews.Author: ncampbebg
Reviews.Content: I came very close to purchasing this camera from Best Buy after reading many reviews.  I came to amazon to read some more reviews and saw that they are selling for $100 less!  If you take the time to get to know your camera, you will take some great pictures.  I am far from a pro, but a little practice and I'm taking some great pictures.  The video mode is a little less than could be expected...but then again I didn't buy this camera as a video camera.  Overall a great camera, and with a price tag of $245 I was able to purchase it along with a 3 year  square trade extended warranty and still come in about $50 short of Best Buy's price tag!

Reviews.Title: Happy with this camera
Reviews.Author: Anne Dwyer
Reviews.Content: In college I borrowed a friend's Olympus SLR camera and had a ball. I got an A in the class. This probably bonded me to Olympus forever. My own camera for a long time was a Nikkormat. Another great SLR, but heavy and intrusive. I decided to begin taking pictures again and have loved this little Olympus. It is a higher end point and shoot, I can manipulate it a bit, but do not have as much freedom as I had with the completely manual cameras. The camera comes with a good amount of storage. I've bought an SD card and my next accessory will be an extra battery. This camera has made the world of digital photography quite seductive!

Reviews.Title: Olympus SP 800-uz
Reviews.Author: Home Handy Man
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is excellent with great resolution.  The original battery that came with the camera ran very low after 100 pictures and a 2 minute video so a 2nd or 3rd battery will be necessary.  It is very easy to use with its user friendly menu.  The quality lacks on videos and you cannot use the zoom feature while the video is recording.  It's an excellent camera for the money spent.

Reviews.Title: My first Olympus camera
Reviews.Author: Andris Felipe Vallejo
Reviews.Content: This is my first Olympus camare. I bought it because the zoom 30x, and it works really good. It is very easy to use, and if you want to change any specifications, you can do it any time or if you want to take a picture in AUTO, it works perfect.

Reviews.Title: olympus camera
Reviews.Author: H. Prawl "hprawl"
Reviews.Content: i just purchase this camera and i am in love with it, but right now i am just getting to know how to use it. i think it is the BOM, cant go wrong with this one the best choice for my money. Thank you

Reviews.Title: Nice camera & features
Reviews.Author: Karaoke Lady
Reviews.Content: I thought I was going to love this camera, instead I returned it. I was disappointed with the video having no sound when zoomed. The color quality on some of my pictures were off, not the true color. The 30x zoom was awkward. Felt the picture quality wasn't that great. I returned the Olympus and bought the Canon Powershot SX210IS and I am loving this little camera. It is great, with a 14x wide angle zoom. There is audio on video with zoom and it is more compact. The picture quality in my opinion is so much sharper with better colors. Before you buy Olympus check out this new Canon. I should have visited You Tube first. Compare the two cameras on you tube watch the fantastic video taken with the Canon vs Olympic.

Reviews.Title: Cheaper than a DSLR! Picture quality still good.
Reviews.Author: Ronald Ellis "eche981"
Reviews.Content: I am pretty new to the whole picture taking lifestyle. I have done a little research and talked with some folks about bang for the buck. I was pointed in the direction of the Ultra Zoom cameras by our Military Photographer. He said what i was trying to do with photography was not going to need a full tilt DSLR with a ton of extras.I was just looking to take great high pixel pictures to learn to use all of the great photo editing software that is available. I got my SP-800UZ about 2 weeks ago. It is rather small but over all it looks and functions great. Make sure that you read the manual. I used it for about an hour before I figured out the digital zoom was turned off out of the box. Once turned on it really came to life ,it was really neat. I could zoom in on a poster across the room and read the printed date. Also with this camera a tri pod is going to be a great addition. Stable photos with great zoom in a handheld seem very hard. Stick it on a tripod and they really become much more clear and easier to take. The Macro setting is crazy. You can literly touch what you are taking a picture of with the lens and still take a great clear picture. If you are on the fence about what to buy do your research. There is a great photo galley at [...]  it has all the features and video of thiscamera.

Reviews.Title: From a birder's view...it's a great camera to carry around without effort!
Reviews.Author: Bookworm

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Kevin "Full_House_in_NH"
Reviews.Content: The first thing I'm disappointed with is that it doesn't have an optical view finder. I didn't realize this when I bought it and for me it makes a big difference.  This camera is less intuitive than my other camera, a Canon PowerShot S5 IS.  I have tried changing some settings and I keep getting a message, "conflicting settings".  I can't seem to get it to 30x zoom.  The zoom is currently not much better than the 12x on my S5.  I did a test with these two cameras.  I stood in one spot and took the same shot with each camera.  The S5 didn't zoom in quite as close, but the resulting photo was better and clearer when enlarged, even though it is an 8MP compared with the Olympus' 14MP.  I admit I have not read the online manual, but I never needed to read the manual for the S5 and I have used it for 2+ years without the same difficulties.  The only reason I bought the Olympus SP-800UZ was for the 30x zoom, which I assumed would be FAR better than a 12x. I'm thinking of returning this camera if I can't get this issue resolved.  Maybe next time I should go to a retail store where I can get a better look at, and try, what I am buying. I wish I had not spent two ninety nine so impulsively.

Reviews.Author: fabian
Reviews.Content: I used to have a sony camera dsc-h3, I bought this olympus wich was suposed to have some better features (more resolution and zoom, take panoramic pictures). but it was a major disapointment: resolution is not good, color of the pictures never looks like the objects you are seeing; if you use any zoom, pictures get out of focus. at night, i get blurs or spots on any black thing that I take, I've tried all the options of lighting but none of them works fine. The panoramic picture is a joke. I was already disapointed, but I got really pissed when last week a friend got a sony dsc-hx100v, that's a camera, if you have to pay about $200 more, it worths it. you will regret if you buy this olympus, I read the bad reviews before i got it and ignored them...

Reviews.Content: Great camera purchased for daughter. She is very happy with it and the zoom feature works great!A great camera for the price!

Reviews.Title: Really Nice Camera with great Zoom
Reviews.Author: Shyne
Reviews.Content: This camera is really nice. The look is better than I thought it would be. The zoom is great. I have been at nfl games at the top level, I can zoom in and get pictures as if I am on the field with the players. With the video function the same thing. I can get close up and film the games. The quality is really good. At nba games they shoot really well in doors. This was one thing I was concerned with if it would shoot good pictures in a gym setting. Pretty much in every setting that I have found it shoots really well. It has a nice flash to brighten the photo if needed. A lot of times I don't use the flash. I think you get a lot out of this camera for the money. Sometimes it may take a while to focus, but it is not bad at all. This is something else I was looking for. I didn't want a camera that took a long time to focus on every picture. I am that type of person that does a lot of research before I buy something. This is what I decided to buy and have been happy with it. This is actually my second one, my friend dropped my last one and the screen was blank. It still took pictures but you couldn't see what you were taking pics of. This is off one drop. So don't drop the camera :-). It was dropped on a hard cement too so I am sure that didn't help. But overall good camera.

Reviews.Title: Just what I expected
Reviews.Author: Jerry R
Reviews.Content: The camera was as advertised, delivered on time what more could I ask.  I have had a couple Olympus Cameras and have always been pleased with quality and clarity of pictures.

Reviews.Content: Great camera for the price but a few complaints. You can't see the lcd in bright sunlight forget it. If you want to take video and zoom in the sound is automatically muted. Reviews.Content: I LOVE the camera, however I am very unhappy with all of the junk e-mail that I have been recieving since buying the camera.  Maybe it's just a coincidance...hmmmmm.

Reviews.Content: The camera is good for the price i paid for it 250.00 but i would not pay more. Reviews.Title: My New Olympus SP-800UZ Digital Camera Arrived!
Reviews.Author: lp
Reviews.Content: I ordered the Olympus SP-800UZ, Silver, 14MP, 30X Wide OPT (26MM Wide), 3" LCD, LI50B, SD/SDH camera to replace my Fuji camera that I gave to my daughter for her birthday.  My Fuji was a good camera, I loved it, but it had so many features that I would get really confused trying to operate it, other than just point and shoot.  I read the reviews on the Olympus SP-800UZ, and was excited about the 30X Zoom that it provided.  I am an amature at taking photographs, but I love pictures, all the in's and out's of photography is more than I have patience for with any camera, so all I want is a good picture result, with whatever I use to take pictures with.  I could do without the video in a camera, for I have a video camcorder that I like to use when I do take video's.  I wasn't looking for that in a camera, but most I looked at with higher pixels and zoom features had the video as well.  I received my Olympus camera the next day after I ordered it.  Amazon is good to send the items I have ordered promptly.  My card didn't come till the third day after I received the camera, but that was ok, as I was getting use to the camera somewhat, and playing with the zoom.  I do really like the zoom, the menu seems nice and easy to understand as well.  One thing I did not like, is the software that came within the camera, of which I do not intend to use, I use Paint Shop Pro for my pictures.  I uninstalled the software after reviewing it, and just simply browsed thru my Paint Shop Pro software and received the pictures from the camera that way.  When I received the card I had purchased for use with the camera, I formated and that seemed to solve the problem of my computer hanging up when the camera would load the software, it seemed to just keep wanting to load the software for some reason, maybe I wasn't doing something right, but since I didn't like the camera's software anyways, problem with that was solved, or I hope so!  The manual I installed onto my computer, and kept.  The setup instructions was confusing to say the least, and the print was so tiny I had to use a magnifier to see it!  The zoom is nice, but when you are zoomed to full capacity it is hard to focus, the least movement blurs the image.  I will have to learn how to do that correctly.  I haven't taken but a few pictures to get the feel of the camera, but what pictures I took that I kept a steady hand was really nice.  It took the battery a long time to charge thru the computer, so I used the adapter after about 4 hours waiting.  I would have given a five star rating on first impression of this camera, I like how it feels, and once I get used to it's functions, and learn some about it I think I will grow to really love it, the only thing that wasn't to my liking was the included software with the camera, the tiny print of the Quick Start Instructions and it's lack of clarity in directions, and the charging of the battery time.  I have an extra battery due to come soon, and know right off that I will need one charged as back up, if I am to use my camera extensively.  I like dealing with Amazon, and I hope to love this camera eventually for it is nice in most all of it's features.  For someone who is not an expert either with camera's or the picture taking in's and out's, doing thing's manually with a camera, I think the menu within this camera will be a big help to me.  So on less than a week with the camera, so far I have worked around what I didn't like, and am pleased with the camera itself.  Who knows even the video feature might even come in handy for me.

Reviews.Author: SuzieQ
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice camera, however, it didn't suit my needs even after reading the many reviews & research I did before buying it. Reviews.Title: the best camera i've ever had
Reviews.Author: navisailor 1203
Reviews.Content: I am very satisfied with the product. The product arrived within the agreed time and in very good condition. i had olympus cameras before this one but this is the best. It takes very good pictures and with it's ultra 30x zoom you can get perfect close pictures.

Reviews.Title: great camera but...
Reviews.Author: P. Harding
Reviews.Content: Just got this camera and am very impressed with the features and picture quality. Of course, I am not a pro but have taken enough pictures in my lifetime to recognize good pictures(especially after all those years of wasting 35mm film). Right now the only complaint is the unshielded lcd screen. Already I have discovered that it is difficult to see the screen quite often. This lends one to HOPE that the picture is good. I even bought a delkin shield(3 inch which doesn't perfectly fit)and it has minimum effect on the glare. I hope olympus comes up with a sunshade as an accessory in the near future. Love the zoom and in my opinion it takes sequential pictures at super speed.  I gave it a 4 because of the glare problem. Also love the ease of making panoramic pictures. It is soooooo easy. Some reviewers complain that you have to do everything via the menu on the screen. It is very easy to figure out how to use the features and there are even explanations about the features when you browse through the menu. Very intuitive and user friendly. Have a lot more to explore about the features of the camera. Next week a trip to the local zoo is on the agenda. Figure that is a great way to get more expertise with this camera.

I printed the manuel for him, though he hasn't read much of it yet.  Hopefully he will and really use all it's options. Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera

Reviews.Content: For the money, this camera is quite simply one of the best in the market. I love the quality of the pics and the product is built so well.

Reviews.Title: grainy pictures no color
Reviews.Author: disapointed "hatedit"
Reviews.Content: I had the misfortune of having this camera in my for 5 days, I have had different types of cameras but this camera by far is the worst camera I have ever owned.  I would take a picture in full sunlight & it would be so dark you couldn't even tell it was daylight, (yes it didn't matter what setting you used) when you would go to zoom it was all megapixels it would never clear in the viewfinder.  I don't know if I had a lemon or not apparently I did from the other review but if I were you DON'T BUY THIS CAMERA. It did have nice qualities it was light if it had zoomed the right way it would have been awesome. But every picture I took was dark & grainy & the flash always had to be on even outside.

Reviews.Title: Fuzzy Pictures and more FUZZY PICTURES
Reviews.Author: Ancient DIY'er "Gregg"
Reviews.Content: This looked good in the store but the pictures are just awful!  I've tried all modes and the pictures are more what I would expect from a sub $50 camera or a child's toy.  Even on the full 14 megapixel mode and all of the settings on the best quality the edges are fuzzy and everything looks in soft focus.  Ive tried every setting with and without flash.  If a 14 megapixel shot is printed 4" x 6" it doesn't look too bad, but anything larger is unsatisfactory.  I bought the camera to replace an older Sony 5 megapixel whose screen was starting to go bad but still takes good pictures.  The Sony at 2 megapixels takes better pictures than the Olympus SP-800UZ at full 14 megapixels.  To be honest, the display is large and easy to see in most light. I like the on screen explanations of the settings, but the pictures (the reason to have a camera) are terrible.  Another negative is that there is no way to put a filter on the lens to protect it.  The software is slower than slow and pops up all sorts of little annoying windows asking "are you sure" and there are no shortcuts to bypass the steps I'm not interested in using.  I did try some of the software options to "fix" the fuzzy pictures and it only made the situation worse.  If I could give it minus one star, I would.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: bb
Reviews.Content: I am no photographer but for my use the camera does the job. So far it has been easy to use, but I have not tried any special settings as of yet. It was nice having 2 GB of memory come with the camera. The photo quality is very nice.

Reviews.Title: An Interesting Camera
Reviews.Author: Augustin Man
Reviews.Content: What captured my attention to this camera had been the huge zoom in such a tiny frame (lens excepted, just a little bigger than my Canon 210IS), a singular achievement (even the recent issued Canon SX30 is bulkier and much heavier (601g vs 416g)).Testing it I've discovered other qualities but also drawbacks. The zoom was rewarding, but of course some rules had to be obeyed at its maximum. The Fine Zoom gives you a plus in performance at the price of the image size (8M maximum). I liked the menu also (mainly the classical selection wheel transfered within the display). I'd liked to mention some other nice features (photo "paraphernalia" if you wish) like the auto-mode panorama and the drawing mode.At the beginning I've been rather upset by the absence of the manual mode (the lack of the viewfinder had not been a problem for me); then I've discovered I could emulate the desired configurations by the settings in the menu, admittedly a more complicated way.When shooting movies you have to decide if you want to use the optical zoom variation and no sound recording, or to choose the sound and the digital zoom variation only. I think this is because the zooming in being rather noisy.As drawbacks besides the ones in the list I'd like to mention the battery charging through the camera, so blocking any activity during the action. I'm advising for a spare and a charger.All in all I believe it is an interesting and rewarding camera, but don't buy it if you're not ready to make some effort to learn a new operating way.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Leanne Bradley
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera on the advice of a friend and am not disappointed. I love the features and I am finding out that it is a lot smarter than I am in some cases as I am learning to use it. it is light years ahead of my ten year old Olympus 1.2 megapixal with only digital zoom.

I scrolled through as many options as I could find, and never could work out how to operate the camera well. Also, it does NOT come with a memory card. Fortunately I had one from another camera. I would suggest that complete written instructions come with the camera or directions to a link where they could be found.  If this had been the case, I would have likely kept the camera.

Reviews.Title: awesome camera

Reviews.Title: Not up to Olympus standards-returned
Reviews.Author: Jacksmacks "Jack"
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd olympus in this family. The first one I had from 2004 until 2009. It was amazing in so many ways. I upgraded to the 800 but I had to send it off for repairs and needed a new camera to take on my trip to Peru.This camera was such a disappointment. The zoom is great and stabilization is okay.My main problem is that it over exposes everything. I shot day shots at -1.0 and night shots I had to play with it.. night shots with a handheld should not look like day shots. The camera flash is too bright unless you are more than 10 feet away and zoom in .. which is rediculous. I was so disappointed that I had to buy a new camera in Peru at twice the cost.The battery life was disappointing but thankfully I'd bought an extra.The camera didn't even have the same sharpness as the old cameras. I'll take my old camera any day over this.I've returned it and expect a refund for a lemon in the olympus family.

Reviews.Title: huge dissapointment
Reviews.Author: Frank Fusco "Frank"
Reviews.Content: I had looked forward to this purchase because of the many features. The extreme zoom, high mps, etc. But, thus far the camera has been a huge dissapointment. The menue is very lengthy and settings do not always do what they are supposed to. But, by far, the most inconvenient feature is that the camera is simply very hard to hold. No thought given to holding it. Close up focus is tricky and has given very poor picture quality. Flash is a problem, pictures often are very dark telling me the sync is off. This may need repair or replacment. I'm a former professional photographer and miss manual settings. This camera is supposed to have manual settings but those have not functioned properly. I give this item a very low rating and a 'do not buy' reccomendation.

Reviews.Title: S-L-O-W
Reviews.Author: Drosophila
Reviews.Content: This is one S-L-O-W camera. The start-up time (until ready for first shot) is over four seconds, which feels like an eternity when you  have a live subject in front of you (human or beast). And two seconds between shots (without flash) - very frustrating. And the autofocus is extremely frustrating: unless the lighting is excellent, it takes forever to focus, often failing altogether. What good is that long beautiful zoom capability if your subject's gone by the time you're ready to shoot? I had to get rid of mine, planning to pick up a Nikon S8200 instead: less zoom, but FAST.

Reviews.Author: ToniJ
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  I switched away from Olympus with my last purchase but had two of them before.  The range of the camera is exceptional and unusual for this price point.  The quality of the pictures is wonderful as well.I don't understand folks issues with the Menu system as it seems to be easy to me.  I admit that I don't do a lot of fancy stuff.  I just want the camera to do most of it for me.Also wonderfully light for the capabilities in this little package.  Can still put it in my purse even though it is a bit more than a point and shoot.I don't understand why you don't see more of these in stores rather than just online.

Reviews.Title: Learning to Love
Reviews.Author: Nita
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to get this.  I first saw it from a T.V. retailer and ordered it on wait list. My old point and shoot was only 2 years old but I was starting to see the quality of photos and videos degrade.  I was especially excited that this Olympus had high-def video too!  I was all in!  Then next day I saw it here at Amaazon for bout 40 bucks cheaper (inclusive).  I quickly canned the wait list and grabbed it here at Amazon. In hindsight  I wish I had shelled out the extra 40 for the option of an easy return.  The seller I got it from here charges a restocking fee, opps...my bad.  I'm not one to just give away money like that so I keep it.No major complaints about the camera but after having a compact point and shoot this bulky "slr style" is well...cramping my style.  Where am I gonna put it in my purse?  And a camera bag? That's so "90's" lol.Yes the video capabilities is improved (which I like)!  The wind noise is extreme outdoors however.  The zoom is pretty amazing (when I keep it steady).  The regular photos are a crap shoot, sometime good sometime not, even with flash up it is spotty.  For these reasons I think I would just be happier with a compact "point and shoot style camera" with HD video.  In fact less than a week later ANOTHER t.v. retailer was pushing one 100 dolla cheaper than the olympus and it was cuter too but I'm stuck with what I have.  Maybe I'm just a commitment phob...Oh well's either way I still have a good camera, just have to take the time to get the settings right (translation-read manuel) and get used to lugging it around.  It's not love at first, but with work I could learn to love it...(translation-I HAVE NO CHOICE)!!

It is is a little complicated to use as it has many alternative features however the poctures are good. I tried to use it yesterday and the zoom lens comes out and stays out. The controller that should move the lens has stopped working. It still takes pictures and videos, which I will use it for now but for ordinary photography I will have to buy a new one. Reviews.Title: Do not buy
Reviews.Author: Tamara F
Reviews.Content: Total disappointment.  Read the reviews and saved for months to buy it.  Got it and took 300 pictures in 24 hours in all conditions:  outside, inside, motion, portrait, close-up.  Seriously not even 1 good shot.  I tried all the settings and normally only use the auto setting on any camera.  No setting could produce a single useable picture. Very slow to take 2 pictures in a row, very slow to actually take the picture, and impossible to get a clear image if your subject moves ever so slightly.Actually returned this camera 1 day after purchase and that speaks volumes because I never return anything.

Reviews.Title: Major Disappointment
Reviews.Author: C. Spritzer
Reviews.Content: After taking a very long time to set up the camera I was excited to try it out.  Imagine my surprise when I found that I only had part of the viewing screen.  Both sides and on the bottom are just black.  I tried to take a couple of test pictures and when they were printed out it was the same, the area on the sides and bottom are empty.  This does not seem to be happening in video mode.  Has anyone else experienced this?  I can find nothing in the on line manual that helps me with this problem.  I have an e-mail into tech support but being the weekend I have yet to hear back from them.  Also I have had problems with the conflict of settings message.  I can not turn on the digital zoom with any setting I have tried.  I plan on returning this camera in the morning.  Although I imagaine that I have a defective camera I think I will stick with my Fuji 18x zoom until these new 30x cameras are perfected.  Unless someone has a suggestion on a GOOD high zoom camera.

Reviews.Title: Me siento como un profesional
Reviews.Author: Alejandro
Reviews.Content: Hola, luego de muchas vueltas por la red decidí comprar esta cámara por todo lo que ofrece, además de ser la más complete de su tipo, definitivamente no me arrepiento en absoluto de la compra, en primer lugar por el precio tan competitivo en comparación a otras de características similares, y de otra parte porque en realidad me siento orgulloso exhibiendo a mis amigos y familiares las fotografías que he logrado, en muchos casos debo hacer una demostración porque me han dicho que las imagenes son muy buenas para ser tomadas por un aficionado como yo, o que son imagenes de muestra...He leido algunos comentarios negativos pero creo que obedecen a una manipulación erronea del equipo o tal vez a un equipo defectuoso, porque yo estoy verdaderamente satisfecho con mi cámara...Con la ayuda del manual he aprendido a usar todos los modos de exposición, las tomas de aves y otros animales en la naturaleza son estupendas gracis a su ultra zoom y a la función super macro, también he logrado excelentes fotografías panorámicas de hasta 360 grados con el software incluido, y lo que mas me ha gustado es poder retener los mejores momentos del crecimiento de mi pequeña hija de 19 meses de edad, capturando fotografías y videos de excelente calidad.Si eres un aficionado con delirios de profesional, ésta es la cámara para tí.

Reviews.Title: bought and on the way -=- received and terrible
Reviews.Author: Loren C. Troescher "Karl Loren"
Reviews.Content: Written before it arrived. See below for after it arrived.  Will never buy Olympus again.I watched the QVC promotion at just a couple dollars less than Amazon, but had to add shipping, so looked here on Amazon and with prime shipping (free) the price was about $3 higher than QVC, but less in final total.My first fancy camera 16 years ago, bought in Hong Kong, was Olympus, used it for years, back in the days of 35 mm, thousands of pictures.I've gone up in features and down in price since then, with many digital cameras.Now they are so cheap that the low cost is as bad as the low value.This Olympus?  It will take, like always, hundreds of hours of study to do all that stuff, and I'll write another review after I've used it for a month or so.I've recently bought three video cameras at Amazon, threw two away, using my Flip which I like, but this Olympus puts me in a bigger league for movies than I've =been in.I bought and returned several video editing programs, all much too fancy, finally got a early version, Adobe Premier Pro 1.5 and it is finally simple enough to learn for an 80 year old guy.So I've put my first title on a video now, published it on Vimeo, with the Olympus and that simple editing program I'll have a ball.More later.The four stars are prospective conservative.  I look forward to giving 5 stars next.Karl LorenThe Olympus Camera arrived as promised, but the possibly wonderful camera has installation instructions that are extremely confusing, kicked me out of the installation several times and tried to take over many other programs I use regularly to handle pictures.The "privacy notice" was impossible to read. The "benefits of registration" were impossible to read. The final launch of the software presented an almost completely black screen with tiny amount of vague gray words and menu items that could not be read. This seems to be popular currently. I bot an Adobe video editing program, the latest, sent it back immediately and got a copy of the similar Adobe editing program from years ago -- easy to use.The camera may be great for a geek but it was a terrible disappointment for me.Karl Loren
